intro: Psychotria ghanensis, commonly known as the Ghana psychotria, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and undergrowth. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
